steps.title: Pour the milk into a large pot and heat until it reaches 86F (30C).
steps.content: Pour the milk into a large pot and heat until it reaches 86F (30C).

steps.title: Stir in the mesophilic powder until it has dissolved, then leave the milk untouched for 45 minutes, making sure that the temperature remains at 86F (30C).
steps.content: Stir in the mesophilic powder until it has dissolved, then leave the milk untouched for 45 minutes, making sure that the temperature remains at 86F (30C).

steps.title: Cut curds into cubes of 1/2 inch (1.27 cm) in size once they are set.
steps.content: Cut curds into cubes of 1/2 inch (1.27 cm) in size once they are set.

steps.title: Raise the temperature gently to 97F (39C) over the next 40 minutes, and slowly stir.
steps.content: Raise the temperature gently to 97F (39C) over the next 40 minutes, and slowly stir.

steps.title: Allow the temperature of the curds to remain at 97F (39C) for the next 30 minutes, while stirring to keep curds from clumping together.
steps.content: Allow the temperature of the curds to remain at 97F (39C) for the next 30 minutes, while stirring to keep curds from clumping together.

steps.title: Do not disturb the curds by stirring in the final 5 minutes.
steps.content: Do not disturb the curds by stirring in the final 5 minutes.

steps.title: Place cheesecloth over a strainer and strain the curds.
steps.content: Place cheesecloth over a strainer and strain the curds. Keep as much of the whey as it takes to fill 1/3 of your pot. Place the strainer containing the curds inside the pot with the whey, cover and keep at a constant temperature of 97F (39C) for 1 hour.

steps.title: Take the curds out from the strainer and slice them into long thin strips, and mix with coarse salt.
steps.content: Take the curds out from the strainer and slice them into long thin strips, and mix with coarse salt.

steps.title: Put the cheese curds into a press and let it sit overnight.
steps.content: Put the cheese curds into a press and let it sit overnight. The next morning, take the cheese out of the press and let it dry.

steps.title: Pour the milk into a large pot and heat until it reaches 90F (32.2C).
steps.content: Pour the milk into a large pot and heat until it reaches 90F (32.2C).

steps.title: Add the yogurt and keep the heat at a constant temperature for 15 minutes while stirring.
steps.content: Add the yogurt and keep the heat at a constant temperature for 15 minutes while stirring.

steps.title: Put the rennet tablet in the pot and continue to mix for about 4 to 5 more minutes.
steps.content: Put the rennet tablet in the pot and continue to mix for about 4 to 5 more minutes.

steps.title: Cover the pot and continue to keep the temperature constant.
steps.content: Cover the pot and continue to keep the temperature constant. Do not disturb the pot or stir for 30 minutes.

steps.title: Chop the curds that have formed into 1/2 in.
steps.content: Chop the curds that have formed into 1/2 in. (1.27cm) cubes, and then let them sit for 15 minutes while stirring intermittently.

steps.title: Raise the temperature gently to 118F (47.7C) over the next 45 minutes, then let the temperature remain at 118F (47.7C) for a constant 15 minutes.
steps.content: Raise the temperature gently to 118F (47.7C) over the next 45 minutes, then let the temperature remain at 118F (47.7C) for a constant 15 minutes.

steps.title: Reserve the whey, and put the curd into a flat, warm pan and turn it over every 15 minutes for a total period of 2 hours.
steps.content: Reserve the whey, and put the curd into a flat, warm pan and turn it over every 15 minutes for a total period of 2 hours.

steps.title: Cut the curd into strips that are 1 to 2 in.
steps.content: Cut the curd into strips that are 1 to 2 in. wide (2.5 to 5cm) and place them in water at a temperature of 180F (82C). Use wooden spoons to stretch and turn the curd until it is stretchy.

steps.title: Take the curd out of the hot water and form it into a ball, then place it in water at a temperature of 40F (4.4C) for about 1 hour.
steps.content: Take the curd out of the hot water and form it into a ball, then place it in water at a temperature of 40F (4.4C) for about 1 hour.

steps.title: Make a salt brine and place the cheese into it.
steps.content: Make a salt brine and place the cheese into it. After a period of 24 hours, take the cheese out and let it dry. You can then eat it or place it in plastic wrap to store it .

steps.title: Finished.
steps.content: Finished.
